cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 785 miles ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the southwestern Atlantic, aiming for the North/South Carolina coastline, then slowing and bending inland toward the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: between Cape Fear, NC and Myrtle Beach, SC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch and Hurricane Watch extend from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC and north of Duck NC to the NC/VA border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge and Hurricane Warnings from South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact expected along the North Carolina and northern South Carolina coasts; Georgia coast mainly experiences swells and peripheral rainfall
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty easterly winds late Thursday into Friday; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤8% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal water rise (generally <1 ft) possible due to long-period swells; no significant surge expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could produce 1–3 inches, locally higher, Thursday night through Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning immediately and persisting until the storm moves inland.
